title: Consumer group rebalance takes too long with large number of partitions
description: When running a Kafka consumer group with 1000+ partitions, the rebalance protocol takes over 5 minutes to complete. This causes significant downtime and message processing delays. The issue appears to be related to the SyncGroup phase where each consumer sends its assignment to the coordinator. Proposed solution: implement incremental cooperative rebalancing to avoid stop-the-world pauses.

comments.author: John Smith
comments.body: I can reproduce this issue on Kafka 2.8. The rebalance time scales linearly with partition count.

comments.author: Jane Doe
comments.body: PR submitted with fix implementing KIP-429 incremental cooperative rebalancing.

title: Incorrect results in LEFT JOIN with complex filter conditions
description: Spark SQL returns incorrect results when performing a LEFT JOIN with filter conditions in the WHERE clause that reference the right table. The issue occurs because the filter is incorrectly pushed down before the join, converting the LEFT JOIN to an INNER JOIN semantically. This violates SQL standard behavior and can lead to data loss in production pipelines.

comments.author: Alice Johnson
comments.body: This is a critical correctness bug. We lost data in production due to this issue.
